required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Laser Assisted ICSI; Has it Role Whatsoever?
clinical_study.official_title: Laser Assisted ICSI; Has it Role Whatsoever? Does it Affect the ICSI Outcome Positively?1

brief_summary.textblock: laser-assisted ICSI (LA-ICSI) was described to be a new method combining a less invasive ICSI technique with assisted hatching.This procedure is usually used for MII oocytes possessing oolemma breakage difficulties, but why not using it for even normal Oocytes?!. Especially because data indicated that in addition to an improved oocyte survival, this new approach increases the hatching rate in vitro. But since it is still debatable that such a small opening might impair the hatching process, so modified zona thinning technique was proposed for more embryo safety.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study aims to compare the LA- ICSI by drilling a micro hole (LAD-ICSI) and modified LA-ICSI by zona pellucida thinning (LAT-ICSI) with conventional ICSI in order to effectively assess whether this approach can be applied routinely to improve ICSI outcome.
One arm study divided into three interventions; Conventional ICSI (control group) was compared with LAD-ICSI (Study group 1) and LAT- ICSI (study group 2) in sibling oocytes.
The rates of maturation, fertilization, Devision, Blastulation and good quality blastulation rates were assessed in the three groups
Cases were randomly selected for embryo transfer from the three groups,Then chemical pregnancy and clinical pregnancy rates were compared between the three groups.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: study divided into three interventions; Conventional ICSI (control group) was compared with LAD-ICSI (Study group 1) and LAT- ICSI (study group 2) in sibling oocytes. then Cases randomly selected for embryo transfer from each group

primary_outcome.description: confirmed by sac observation using ultrasound

secondary_outcome.description: number of blastocysts that are grown from devided embryos
number of blastocysts that hatch out of zona

clinical_study.condition: Laser Assistance to Improve ICSI Outcome

arm_group.description: Conventional ICSI procedure was done for first portion of sibling oocytes
Laser assisted drilling ICSI procedure was done for second portion of sibling oocytes
Laser assisted thinning ICSI procedure was done for Third portion of sibling oocytes

intervention.description: using OCTICS laser device to do small opening or zona thinning to improve ICSI outcome

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged from 20 years old to 37 years old
- good res-ponders
- gives more than 15 oocytes
- endometrial thickness more than 9 mm
Exclusion Criteria:
- poor res-ponders
- severe oligoasthinozoospermia of male partners
- testicular samples
- Poor quality oocytes
